column4: oooh, ubuntu-restricted-extras, I must look that up, thanks, sounds useful
no problem but thanks for the warning, I'll do it when bandwidth is available :-)

It just troubles me that ubuntu is so good for thrusting into the hands of a microsoft user, saying hey try this, and usually it 'just works' for them. But if there's no java at all (and undocumented geeky hoops to jump through) I fear they'll just give up.
of course there's java. Just install it.
